CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the LOC region .
CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant was serving a sentence for robbery in correctional colony no . LIU-CARDINAL in the LOC region .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE he attempted suicide by opening his veins .

CARDINAL . On DATE a prison psychiatrist diagnosed the applicant as suffering from a slight mental retardation , psychopathy and claustrophobia with elements of self - aggression . An entry was made in his medical records that solitary confinement was contraindicated for mental health reasons . The correctional colony authorities were informed accordingly . The applicant was prescribed treatment . Since that time he had been examined by the prison psychiatrist at regular intervals . The prison psychiatrist ’s diagnosis and recommendations were confirmed by the psychiatric unit of prison hospital no . CARDINAL where the applicant was treated from CARDINAL to DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the governor of the correctional colony ordered the applicant ’s placement in a punishment cell for DATE as a punishment for the disorderly state of his bed and bedside table .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was examined by the prison doctor on duty who found that his state of health permitted his placement in a punishment cell , provided that he was not held in solitary confinement .
CARDINAL . The applicant was then placed in punishment cell no . CARDINAL designed to accommodate CARDINAL inmates . He was left alone in the cell , but the door was kept open .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went on a hunger strike in protest against his placement in solitary confinement .

CARDINAL . At TIME on CARDINAL DATE the applicant was visited by the prison doctor on duty who examined him and found that his health was satisfactory . He reiterated the recommendation that given the applicant ’s mental condition solitary confinement was contraindicated .

CARDINAL . After the doctor left , the door of the applicant ’s cell was shut . TIME the applicant had a panic attack and attempted to open his veins with his teeth . The doctor was called back . He noted numerous lacerated wounds on the applicant ’s forearms and made bandages .
CARDINAL . By letters of DATE , DATE and DATE the applicant asked the prosecutor ’s office of LOC to initiate criminal proceedings against the warders on duty .

CARDINAL . On DATE a deputy prosecutor of ORG refused to open criminal proceedings . He referred to statements by a warder , PERSON . , that the applicant had himself asked him to shut the door . Moreover , the applicant ’s health had not been seriously damaged as a result of the incident .

CARDINAL . It follows from the letter of DATE from the prosecutor of ORG that the prosecutor ’s office had found that the applicant had been lawfully placed in a punishment cell . At the same time , the warders had disrespected the doctor ’s recommendation by leaving the applicant alone in a closed cell . The governor of correctional colony no . LIU-CARDINAL had been warned against “ permitting similar incidents to occur in future ” .

CARDINAL . Following to further complaints by the applicant , in which he stated in particular that he had never asked the warders to close the door , the prosecutor of ORG conducted an additional inquiry . He questioned the applicant and PERSON . He also questioned warders PERSON and PERSON who testified that the door to the applicant ’s cell had been temporarily closed to prevent his communication with other inmates who were at that time receiving clean bedding in the storage room opposite to the applicant ’s cell .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor of PERSON refused to open criminal proceedings against the warders . He found that the warders had acted in compliance with the internal regulations and had had no intention of provoking the applicant to self - injury .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the prosecutor ’s decisions of DATE and DATE before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the prosecutor ’s decisions , finding that the inquiry had been thorough and the refusals to open criminal proceedings had been lawful and justified .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant appealed . He submitted , in particular , that the warders had known that he suffered from claustrophobia and had closed the door to take vengeance on him for going on a hunger strike .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE on appeal .
